basicInfoDesc: Basic information of this AWS account
connectionTips: The connection may takes around 20-30 seconds.
connectToDataSourceForAccount: Connect to data source for account Id:
connectToDataSourceForAccountDesc: You can create data catalogs by connecting data source.

header.s3Info: The S3 buckets that are discovered in this account. Connect to S3 buckets to create data catalogs.
header.rdsInfo: The RDS instances that are discovered in this account. Connect to RDS instances to create data catalogs.
header.jdbcInfo: The JDBC connections that are discovered in this account. Connect to JDBC connection to create data catalogs.
header.glueInfo: The Glue databases that are discovered in this account.

jdbc.importComment: This connection has been imported by:
jdbc.glueConnectionDesc: Choose an existing Glue connection from AWS account where the SDP platform installed.
jdbc.connectionNameDesc: Enter a unique name for your connection.
jdbc.sslConnectionDesc: The connection will fail if it's unable to connect over SSL.
jdbc.chooseCert: Choose your X.509 certificate. Must be DER-encoded Base64 PEM format.
jdbc.certValidationDesc: By default your custom certificate is validated before use. Turn on this option to skip validation of the certificate algorithm and key length during connection.
jdbc.customJDBCCertStringDesc: Enter your database specific custom certificate info.
jdbc.customJDBCCertConstraint: For Oracle Database this maps to SSL_SERVER_CERT_DN, and for SQL Server it maps to hostNameInCertificate.
jdbc.descriptionDesc: Descriptions can be up to 2048 characters long.
jdbc.jdbcURLDesc: Use the JDBC protocol to access Amazon Redshift, Amazon RDS, and publicly accessible databases.
jdbc.jdbcURLConstraint: JDBC syntax for most database engines is jdbc:protocol://host:port/databasename.
jdbc.jdbcDatabaseDesc: If you have multiple databases in your instance, please provide the list of database names in this area.
jdbc.jdbcClassNameDesc: Type a custom JDBC driver class name for the crawler to connect to the data source.
jdbc.jdbcS3PathDesc: Browse for or enter an existing S3 path to a .jar file.
jdbc.networkDesc: If your Amazon Glue job needs to jdbc resource which existed in other vpc or other cloud provider environment, you must provide additional VPC-specific configuration information.
jdbc.vpcDesc: Choose the virtual private cloud that contains your data source.
jdbc.subnetDesc: Choose the subnet within your VPC.
jdbc.sgDesc: Choose one or more security groups to allow access to the data store in your VPC subnet. Security groups are associated to the ENI attached to your subnet. You must choose at least one security group with a self-referencing inbound rule for all TCP ports.
jdbc.chooseSG: Choose one or more security groups
